review: I have two of these, they work very well although slow to go through the menu and options. The toughest thing about the Apple TV is you are at Apples mercy when it comes to updates at which time they may add one or two new channels, so it really is limited. They do not have Amazon Prime, so I recently purchased the ROKU 3 for that purpose.I guess it's about how you use a streaming device, I don't care about AirPlay; I don't listen to my iTunes on the TV, I don't care about having photos up and I don't rent / buy movies from iTunes. But if you do or like all that this is a five star unit. I just want Prime and maximum streaming options and flexibility, ROKU does that. So don't get me wrong it's like serving a beautifully prepared filet mignon to a vegan! The Apple is best if you; 1. own Apple devices and  2. use them in conjunction with the TV.The other issue I have is the remote has to be very close to the unit and nearly in front to change channels, very annoying. There is an App that takes the place of the remote, and that is certainly useful.Frankly with ROKU at the same price the  Apple doesn't make sense, it  is too limited and not flexible, I should be able to buy Apps the way I do on any Apple product. I cannot recommend.UPDATE: to be fair in reviewing this I am trying out the music channels and they are wonderful! Very surprising fidelity, excellent. Set it up through my receiver and the music reproduction is awesome. Again I continue to feel there are not enough APP options and flexibility compared to the ROKU, but I am among the converted when it comes to what it does offer. I will add I have it connected directly to the router, not WiFi so that helps.I continue to feel it is largely geared to Apple products users, and frankly if it had Prime I wouldn't feel the need for the ROKU. Since I have both I would say if you have to buy only one and want Prime, ROKU is not a compromise. If you don't have Prime and don't care and want the best in Audio/ Video reproduction quality Apple is the way to go.
author: ACRA

review: I love this Apple TV.  I bought it for my wife for Christmas, since she had been asking for it... She loves it, I love it, my son loves it, everyone that see's it loves it, etc!  I love that I can setup sharing and easily stream movies, music, pictures and more from our iTunes on any computer.  I also love that I can use my iPhone to share my screen from my phone right up onto my big screen TV, so I can easily show pictures to people that are over or anything else.  You can rent movies, it has a ton of free radio stations, I love watching YouTube or finding Disney stuff on YouTube for my kids.This thing is worth every penny!
